name: Oddish
flavorText: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

attack.name: Feelin’ Fine
attack.text: Draw a card.

name: Gloom
flavorText: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

attack.name: Inviting Scent
attack.text: Switch in 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.

name: Bellossom
flavorText: Bellossom gather at times and appear to dance. They say that the dance is a ritual to summon the sun.

attack.name: Sleep Powder
attack.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attack.name: Powerful Dance
attack.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 90 damage for each heads.

name: Scyther
flavorText: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.

attack.name: Agility
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent’s next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

name: Shuckle
flavorText: The berries stored in its vaselike shell eventually become a thick, pulpy juice.

attack.name: Berry Scent
attack.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attack.name: Guard Press
attack.text: During your opponent’s next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Surskit
flavorText: They usually live on ponds, but after an evening shower, they may appear on puddles in towns.

attack.name: Lunge
attack.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Masquerain
flavorText: It flaps its four wings to hover and fly freely in any direction—to and fro and sideways.

attack.name: Panic-Prompting Pattern
attack.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard a random card from your opponent’s hand.

name: Combee
flavorText: At night, Combee sleep in a group of about a hundred, packed closely together in a lump.

attack.name: Share
attack.text: Heal 20 damage from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Foongus
flavorText: There is a theory that the developer of the modern-day Poké Ball really liked Foongus, but this has not been confirmed.

attack.name: Enticing Pattern
attack.text: Search your deck for a Basic Grass Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Amoonguss
flavorText: Be wary of the poisonous spores it releases. Mushrooms resembling Amoonguss’s caps will grow out of anywhere the spores touch.

attack.name: Dangerous Spores
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

name: Phantump
flavorText: With a voice like a human child’s, it cries out to lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost among the trees.

name: Trevenant

abilities.name: Forest Miasma
abilities.text: During Pokémon Checkup, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, put 1 damage counter on your opponent’s Active Pokémon.

flavorText: Small roots that extend from the tips of this Pokémon’s feet can tie into the trees of the forest and give Trevenant control over them.

attack.name: Lock Up
attack.text: During your opponent’s next turn, the Defending Pokémon can’t retreat.

name: Rowlet
flavorText: It feels relaxed in tight, dark places and has been known to use its Trainer’s pocket or bag as a nest.

name: Dartrix
flavorText: Supremely sensitive to the presence of others, it can detect opponents standing behind it, flinging its sharp feathers to take them out.

attack.name: Shoot Through
attack.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
name: Decidueye ex

abilities.name: Total Freedom
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may use this Ability. If this Pokémon is on the Bench, switch it with your Active Pokémon. Or, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, switch it with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attack.name: Hunting Arrow
attack.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Bounsweet
flavorText: Its sweat is sweet, like syrup made from boiled- down fruit. Because of this, Bounsweet was highly valued in the past, when sweeteners were scarce.

attack.name: Reckless Charge
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

name: Steenee
flavorText: Steenee spreads a sweet scent that makes others feel invigorated. This same scent is popular for antiperspirants.

attack.name: Aromatherapy
attack.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

name: Tsareena
flavorText: This Pokémon is proud and aggressive. However, it is said that a Tsareena will instantly become calm if someone touches the crown on its calyx.

attack.name: Queenly Heel
attack.text: During your opponent’s next turn, Pokémon can’t be played from your opponent’s hand to evolve the Defending Pokémon.

attack.name: Spinning Kick
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

name: Smoliv
flavorText: It protects itself from enemies by emitting oil from the fruit on its head. This oil is bitter and astringent enough to make someone flinch.

attack.name: Absorb
attack.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Dolliv
flavorText: Dolliv shares its tasty, fresh-scented oil with others. This species has coexisted with humans since times long gone.

attack.name: Sunny Wind
attack.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Arboliva
flavorText: This calm Pokémon is very compassionate. It will share its delicious, nutrient-rich oil with weakened Pokémon.

attack.name: Healing Fruit
attack.text: Heal all damage from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
name: Toedscruel ex

abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks used by your opponent’s Pokémon done to all of your Pokémon that have Energy attached. (Existing effects are not removed. Damage is not an effect.)

attack.name: Colony Rush
attack.text: This attack does 40 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has any Grass Energy attached.

name: Capsakid
flavorText: The more sunlight this Pokémon bathes in, the more spicy chemicals are produced by its body, and thus the spicier its moves become.

attack.name: Reckless Charge
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

name: Capsakid
flavorText: The more sunlight this Pokémon bathes in, the more spicy chemicals are produced by its body, and thus the spicier its moves become.

attack.name: Double Headbutt
attack.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

name: Scovillain

abilities.name: Double Type
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is {G} and {R} type.

flavorText: The red head converts spicy chemicals into fire energy and blasts the surrounding area with a super spicy stream of flame.

attack.text: As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is Grass and Fire type.

attack.name: Spicy Headbutt
attack.text: This attack’s damage isn’t affected by Resistance.

name: Charmander
flavorText: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.

attack.name: Heat Tackle
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

name: Charmeleon
flavorText: If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts intense flames, incinerating its surroundings.

attack.name: Heat Tackle
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

name: Vulpix
flavorText: As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous. When held, it feels slightly warm.

attack.name: Confuse Ray
attack.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Ninetales
flavorText: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.

attack.name: Nine-Tailed Dance
attack.text: Put 9 damage counters on 1 of your opponent’s Pokémon. During your next turn, this Pokémon can’t attack.

name: Entei

abilities.name: Pressure
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, attacks used by your opponent’s Active Pokémon do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

flavorText: It is said that when it roars, a volcano erupts somewhere around the globe.

attack.name: Blaze Ball
attack.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

name: Numel
flavorText: Magma of almost 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit courses through its body. When it grows cold, the magma hardens and slows it.

attack.name: Hot Magma
attack.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Burned.

name: Camerupt
flavorText: It lives in the crater of a volcano. It is well known that the humps on its back erupt every 10 years.

attack.name: Eruption
attack.text: Discard the top card of each player’s deck. This attack does 100 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
name: Victini ex

attack.name: Strafe
attack.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attack.name: Victory Flame
attack.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can’t attack.

name: Darumaka
flavorText: This popular symbol of good fortune will never fall over in its sleep, no matter how it’s pushed or pulled.

attack.name: Surprise Attack
attack.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Darmanitan
flavorText: This Pokémon’s power level rises along with the temperature of its fire, which can reach 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit.

attack.name: Damage Counterpunch
attack.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 60 more damage.

name: Litwick
flavorText: The younger the life this Pokémon absorbs, the brighter and eerier the flame on its head burns.

attack.name: Firebreathing
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

name: Lampent
flavorText: It lurks in cities, pretending to be a lamp. Once it finds someone whose death is near, it will trail quietly after them.

attack.name: Alluring Fireball
attack.text: Switch in 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot. This attack does 30 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

name: Chandelure
flavorText: In homes illuminated by Chandelure instead of lights, funerals were a constant occurrence— or so it’s said.

attack.name: Combustion Chain
attack.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent’s Active Pokémon.

name: Heatmor
flavorText: A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the hard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour their insides.

attack.name: Energy Burner
attack.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent’s Active Pokémon.

name: Larvesta
flavorText: This Pokémon was called the Larva That Stole the Sun. The fire Larvesta spouts from its horns can cut right through a sheet of iron.

attack.name: Take Down
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

name: Volcarona
flavorText: Its burning body causes it to be unpopular in hot parts of the world, but in cold ones, Volcarona is revered as an embodiment of the sun.

attack.name: Flame Cloak
attack.text: Attach a Basic Fire Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

· Tera Pokémon ex rule: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent’s).
name: Eiscue ex

attack.name: Scalding Block
attack.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. During your opponent’s next turn, the Defending Pokémon can’t attack.

name: Charcadet
flavorText: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.

name: Armarouge

abilities.name: Scorching Armor
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent’s Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Burned.

flavorText: Armarouge evolved through the use of a set of armor that belonged to a distinguished warrior. This Pokémon is incredibly loyal.

name: Lapras
flavorText: Crossing icy seas is no issue for this cold-resistant Pokémon. Its smooth skin is a little cool to the touch.

attack.name: Hail
attack.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent’s Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Carvanha
flavorText: These Pokémon have sharp fangs and powerful jaws. Sailors avoid Carvanha dens at all costs.

name: Sharpedo
flavorText: This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sea. Any ship entering the waters Sharpedo calls home will be attacked—no exceptions.

attack.name: Aqua Impact
attack.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent’s Active Pokémon’s Retreat Cost.

name: Buizel
flavorText: It spins its two tails like a screw to propel itself through water. The tails also slice clinging seaweed.

attack.name: Quick Attack
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

name: Floatzel
flavorText: With its flotation sac inflated, it can carry people on its back. It deflates the sac before it dives.

attack.name: Swirling Tail
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put your opponent’s Active Pokémon and all attached cards into your opponent’s hand.

name: Tympole
flavorText: It uses sound waves to communicate with others of its kind. People and other Pokémon species can’t hear its cries of warning.

attack.name: Screw Tail
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent’s Active Pokémon.

name: Palpitoad
flavorText: On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to the ear. Palpitoad with larger lumps on their bodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.

name: Seismitoad

abilities.name: Quaking Zone
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, attacks used by your opponent’s Active Pokémon cost {C} more.

flavorText: This Pokémon is popular among the elderly, who say the vibrations of its lumps are great for massages.

attack.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, attacks used by your opponent’s Active Pokémon cost Colorless more.

attack.name: Echoed Voice
attack.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon’s Echoed Voice attack does 100 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Cubchoo
flavorText: Many of this species can be found along the shorelines of cold regions. If a Cubchoo lacks dangling snot, there’s a chance it is sick.

attack.name: Trip Over
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

name: Beartic
flavorText: It is a ferocious, carnivorous Pokémon. Once it captures its prey, it will breathe cold air onto the prey to freeze and preserve it.

attack.name: Frost Purge
attack.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Cryogonal
flavorText: Cryogonal appear during cold seasons. It is said that people and Pokémon who die on snowy mountains are reborn into these Pokémon.

attack.name: First Freeze
attack.text: If you go second and it’s your first turn, your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Froakie
flavorText: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

attack.name: Try Bouncing
attack.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Frogadier
flavorText: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute’s time.

attack.name: Strafe
attack.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Wiglett
flavorText: This Pokémon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.

name: Wugtrio
flavorText: It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. It wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.

attack.name: Entwining Entrapment
attack.text: During your opponent’s next turn, the Defending Pokémon can’t retreat.

name: Finizen
flavorText: It likes playing with others of its kind using the water ring on its tail. It uses ultrasonic waves to sense the emotions of other living creatures.

attack.name: Valiant Evolution
attack.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Finizen
flavorText: It likes playing with others of its kind using the water ring on its tail. It uses ultrasonic waves to sense the emotions of other living creatures.

name: Palafin
flavorText: This Pokémon’s ancient genes have awakened. It is now so extraordinarily strong that it can easily lift a cruise ship with one fin.

attack.name: Jet Punch
attack.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon. (Don’t apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attack.name: Justice Kick
attack.text: If this Pokémon didn’t move from the Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does nothing.

name: Magnemite
flavorText: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.

name: Magneton
flavorText: Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.

name: Magnezone
flavorText: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.

attack.name: Magnetic Repulsion
attack.text: You may switch out your opponent’s Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

attack.name: Thunder
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

attack.name: Mountain Hurl

attack.name: Lightning Rampage
attack.text: If your Benched Pokémon have any damage counters on them, this attack does 100 more damage.

name: Tynamo
flavorText: While one alone doesn’t have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

name: Eelektrik
flavorText: They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.

attack.name: Volt Wave
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Eelektross
flavorText: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

attack.name: Suction Shock
attack.text: Switch in 1 of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot. If you do, this attack does 60 damage to the new Active Pokémon, and then flip a coin. If heads, that Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Thundurus

abilities.name: Adverse Weather
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, prevent all damage done to your Benched Pokémon by attacks from your opponent’s Pokémon.

flavorText: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.

attack.name: Gigantic Bolt
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 90 damage to itself.

name: Toxel
flavorText: It has no problem drinking dirty water. An organ inside Toxel’s body filters such water into a poisonous liquid that is harmless to Toxel.

attack.name: Slight Intrusion
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

name: Toxtricity
flavorText: Many youths admire the way this Pokémon listlessly picks fights and keeps its cool no matter what opponent it faces.

attack.name: Leer
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attack.name: Loud Mix
attack.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each different type of Pokémon on your Bench.

name: Miraidon ex

attack.name: Rapid Draw
attack.text: Draw 2 cards.

attack.name: Techno Turbo
attack.text: Attach a Basic Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Cleffa
flavorText: Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.

attack.name: Grasping Draw
attack.text: Draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand.

name: Clefairy
flavorText: Its adorable behavior and cry make it highly popular. However, this cute Pokémon is rarely found.

attack.name: Slap Slap
attack.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

rules: · Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.
name: Clefable ex

abilities.name: Lunar Zone
abilities.text: All of your Pokémon that have {P} Energy attached have no Retreat Cost.

attack.text: All of your Pokémon that have Psychic Energy attached have no Retreat Cost.

attack.name: Wondrous Moon
attack.text: You may move any amount of Psychic Energy from your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

name: Togepi
flavorText: It is considered to be a symbol of good luck. Its shell is said to be filled with happiness.

attack.name: Whiny Voice
attack.text: Choose a random card from your opponent’s hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

name: Togetic
flavorText: It grows dispirited if it is not with kind people. It can float in midair without moving its wings.

attack.name: Shared Peace
attack.text: Each player draws 3 cards.

name: Togekiss

abilities.name: Precious Gift
abilities.text: Once at the end of your turn (after your attack), you may use this Ability. Draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand.

flavorText: Known as a bringer of blessings, it’s been depicted on good-luck charms since ancient times.

attack.name: Power Cyclone
attack.text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Espeon
flavorText: The tip of its forked tail quivers when it is predicting its opponent’s next move.

attack.name: Psychic Assault
attack.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent’s Active Pokémon.

attack.name: Psy Bolt
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Snubbull
flavorText: In contrast to its appearance, it’s quite timid. When playing with other puppy Pokémon, it sometimes gets bullied.

attack.name: Double-Edge
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

name: Granbull
flavorText: Although it’s popular with young people, Granbull is timid and sensitive, so it’s totally incompetent as a watchdog.

attack.name: Wild Tackle
attack.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

name: Mawile
flavorText: It chomps with its gaping mouth. Its huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed.

attack.name: Mischievous Crunch
attack.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

name: Spoink
flavorText: Spoink will die if it stops bouncing. The pearl on its head amplifies its psychic powers.

name: Grumpig
flavorText: It can perform odd dance steps to influence foes. Its style of dancing became hugely popular overseas.

attack.name: Powerful Steps
attack.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Lunatone

abilities.name: New Moon
abilities.text: If you have Solrock in play, prevent all effects of any Stadium done to your Pokémon in play.

flavorText: It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike 40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.

name: Solrock
flavorText: Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is strong during the daytime. When it spins, its body shines.

attack.name: Call for Family
attack.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Baltoy
flavorText: It was discovered in ancient ruins. While moving, it constantly spins. It stands on one foot even when asleep.

attack.name: Rapid Spin
attack.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, switch out your opponent’s Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

name: Claydol
flavorText: It appears to have been born from clay dolls made by ancient people. It uses telekinesis to float and move.

attack.name: Kaboom Doll
attack.text: Put damage counters on your opponent’s Active Pokémon until its remaining HP is 10. If you placed any damage counters in this way, this attack also does 120 damage to this Pokémon.

attack.name: Mind Bend
attack.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attack.text: Put 3 damage counters on each of your opponent’s Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

name: Sinistea
flavorText: The soul of someone who died alone possessed some leftover tea. This Pokémon appears in hotels and houses.

attack.name: Cold Tea
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Polteageist
flavorText: The tea that composes Polteageist’s body has a distinct and enjoyable flavor. Drinking too much, however, can be fatal.

attack.name: Antique Collecting
attack.text: Put up to 2 in any combination of Item cards and Pokémon Tool cards from your discard pile into your hand.

attack.name: Pour Tea
attack.text: Put 5 damage counters on your opponent’s Active Pokémon.

name: Greavard
flavorText: It is said that a dog Pokémon that died in the wild without ever interacting with a human was reborn as this Pokémon.

name: Greavard
flavorText: It is said that a dog Pokémon that died in the wild without ever interacting with a human was reborn as this Pokémon.

attack.name: Play Rough
attack.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: Houndstone
flavorText: Houndstone spends most of its time sleeping in graveyards. Among all the dog Pokémon, this one is most loyal to its master.

attack.name: Two Four-ocious
attack.text: If your opponent has exactly 2 or 4 Prize cards remaining, this attack does 120 more damage.

name: Houndstone ex

attack.name: Big Bite
attack.text: During your opponent’s next turn, the Defending Pokémon can’t retreat.

attack.name: Last Respects
attack.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Psychic Pokémon in your discard pile.

name: Diglett
flavorText: It lives about one yard underground, where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.

attack.name: Hole-Diggin’ Noggin
attack.text: Discard the top card of your deck.

name: Dugtrio
flavorText: Its three heads bob separately up and down to loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it to burrow.

attack.name: Dig

flavorText: For some reason, this Pokémon smiles slightly when it emits a strong electric current from the yellow markings on its body.

attack.name: Knuckle Impact

abilities.name: Dust Field
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent can’t have more than 3 Benched Pokémon. If they have 4 or more Benched Pokémon, they discard Benched Pokémon until they have 3 Pokémon on the Bench. If more than one effect changes the number of Benched Pokémon allowed, use the smaller number.

attack.name: Poisonous Gem
attack.text: Your opponent’s Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attack.name: Future Sight
attack.text: Look at the top 3 cards of either player’s deck and put them back in any order.

abilities.name: Infernal Reign
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 3 Basic {R} Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attack.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 3 Basic Fire Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

abilities.text: This Pokémon may have up to 4 Pokémon Tools attached to it. If it loses this Ability, discard Pokémon Tools from it until only 1 remains.

abilities.name: Effect
abilities.text: Once during each player’s turn, that player may search their deck for a Basic Pokémon that doesn’t have a Rule Box and put it onto their Bench. Then, that player shuffles their deck. (Pokémon ex, Pokémon V, etc. have Rule Boxes.)
